content: <ce:simple-para id="sp0025" view="all">Synthesis of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: An aqueous solution (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) of Na<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>pda (0.021<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was slowly added to an aqueous solution (10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL) containing both Cu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·3H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O(0.024<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and Hatrz (0.014<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) with stirring about 1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>h. The resulting solution was filtered and evaporated slowly at room temperature for 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days in a dark place. Blue block-like crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained (yield 46%). Anal. Calcd (%) for C<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">11</ce:inf>CuN<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>: C, 31.00; H, 3.18; N, 20.08. Found: C, 31.12; H, 3.25; N,20.20. IR (Solid KBr pellet, <ce:italic>v</ce:italic>/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>) for 1: 3440 (vs), 3065 (m), 2970 (w), 2923 (w), 1648 (s), 1552 (s), 1427 (m), 1382 (s), 1103 (m), 1082 (m), 871 (w), 763 (m), 741 (w), 652 (w), 616 (w).</ce:simple-para><ce:simple-para id="sp0030" view="all">Synthesis of 2: A mixture of Cu(NO3)2∙3H2O (0.024<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g,0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol), Hatrz (0.014<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g,0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) and H2pda (0.017<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>g, 0.1<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mmol) was placed in a 23<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL Teflon liner and then 6<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL water and 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>mL methanol were added. The resulting suspension was stirred for 10<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>min and was then sealed in a Parr autoclave. The autoclave was placed in a programmable furnace and heated to 170<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C. The temperature was held for 3<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>days, and then the reactant mixture was cooled at a rate of 5<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>°C·min<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup> to formed black block crystals of 2. Yield: 40%. Anal. Calcd (%) for C9H8Cu2N5O5: C, 27.49; H, 2.05; N, 17.81. Found: C, 27.42; H, 2.00; N, 17.92. IR (Solid KBr pellet, v/cm<ce:sup loc="post">−<ce:hsp sp="0.10"></ce:hsp>1</ce:sup>) for 2: 3065 (s), 2970 (w), 1650 (s), 1555 (s), 1427 (s), 1103 (m), 1082 (m), 878 (w), 760 (m), 741 (w), 645 (w).</ce:simple-para>
clean_text:
Synthesis of 1: An aqueous solution (10mL) of Na2pda (0.021g, 0.1mmol) was slowly added to an aqueous solution (10mL) containing both Cu(NO3)2⋅3H2O(0.024g, 0.1mmol) and Hatrz (0.014g, 0.1mmol) with stirring about 1h. The resulting solution was filtered and evaporated slowly at room temperature for 3days in a dark place. Blue block-like crystals suitable for X-ray analysis were obtained (yield 46%). Anal. Calcd (%) for C9H11CuN5O6: C, 31.00; H, 3.18; N, 20.08. Found: C, 31.12; H, 3.25; N,20.20. IR (Solid KBr pellet, v/cm-1) for 1: 3440 (vs), 3065 (m), 2970 (w), 2923 (w), 1648 (s), 1552 (s), 1427 (m), 1382 (s), 1103 (m), 1082 (m), 871 (w), 763 (m), 741 (w), 652 (w), 616 (w).

Synthesis of 2: A mixture of Cu(NO3)2∙3H2O (0.024g,0.1mmol), Hatrz (0.014g,0.1mmol) and H2pda (0.017g, 0.1mmol) was placed in a 23mL Teflon liner and then 6mL water and 10mL methanol were added. The resulting suspension was stirred for 10min and was then sealed in a Parr autoclave. The autoclave was placed in a programmable furnace and heated to 170°C. The temperature was held for 3days, and then the reactant mixture was cooled at a rate of 5°C⋅min-1 to formed black block crystals of 2. Yield: 40%. Anal. Calcd (%) for C9H8Cu2N5O5: C, 27.49; H, 2.05; N, 17.81. Found: C, 27.42; H, 2.00; N, 17.92. IR (Solid KBr pellet, v/cm-1) for 2: 3065 (s), 2970 (w), 1650 (s), 1555 (s), 1427 (s), 1103 (m), 1082 (m), 878 (w), 760 (m), 741 (w), 645 (w).
